Sentencas: Simultaneous electrochemical reduction of CO2 and partial oxidation of CH4 in a solid oxide cell (CO2/CH4 redox SOC) with Ag-based cathode and Ni-based anode is compared with CO2 reduction in a solid oxide electrolysis cell (CO2-SOEC) and CH4 oxidation in a solid oxide fuel cell (CH4-SOFC).
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode

Sentencas: Overpotential losses from different sources and gases products from each electrode are analyzed.
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode

Sentencas: Results show that the process of a CO2/CH4 redox SOC is exactly a combination of the cathode process of a CO2-SOEC and the anode process of a CH4-SOFC.
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode

Sentencas: With the same CO and syngas obtained, a CO2/CH4 redox SOC consumes less energy because it avoids oxygen evolution reaction (OER) of a CO2-SOEC and oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) of a CH4-SOFC.
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode

Sentencas: At 500 mA cm(-2), the overall resistance of an electrolyte-supported CO2/CH4 redox SOC is only half of that for separately reducing CO2 in an SOEC and oxidizing CH4 in an SOFC.
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode

Sentencas: The conversion of CH4 and yield of H-2 in the SOC approach 81% and 63%, respectively.
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode

Sentencas: An anode-supported CO2/CH4 redox SOC is operated stably for 110 h at 1 A cm(-2) under an applied voltage of similar to 0.9 V. Sufficient current density may prevent high performance Ni-based anode from coking.
Titulo: Simultaneous Electrochemical Reduction of Carbon Dioxide and Partial Oxidation of Methane in a Solid Oxide Cell with Silver-Based Cathode and Nickel-Based Anode
